2018-11-25T13:04:20Z: Driver, TeamHamilton, MercedesVettel, FerrariVerstappen, Red BullRicciardo, Red BullBottas, MercedesSainz, RenaultLeclerc, SauberPerez, Force IndiaGrosjean, HaasMagnussen, Haas
2018-11-25T15:13:56Z: It's been an absolute pleasure helping to bring you Live coverage of the 2018 F1 season - we'll see you again in Melbourne next year. We can't wait!
2018-11-25T15:12:15Z: Make sure you stay tuned to Autosport.com and Motorsport.com for all the post-race news from the paddock.
2018-11-25T15:11:37Z: And with that, it's time to end our Live coverage of the 2018 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Check out our race report to recap all the action from the season finale. Lewis Hamilton wins 2018 F1 Abu Dhabi Grand PrixLewis Hamilton ended his title-winning Formula 1 season by dominating the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, which featured a dramatic first-lap crash for Nico Hulkenberg
2018-11-25T15:10:24Z: The drivers emerge from the cool down room to take to the podium for the final time in 2018.
2018-11-25T15:09:44Z: Vettel and Verstappen are swapping stories about the times they went off because of the wind - everyone seems to be getting on jolly well. Almost like the season is over or something.
2018-11-25T15:08:39Z: Hamilton organises a selfie for the top three. No comment.
2018-11-25T15:04:33Z: Hamilton's car has been wheeled onto what looks like a very expensive LED screen below the podium.
2018-11-25T15:01:15Z: Complete Abu Dhabi result:1. Hamilton2. Vettel3. Verstappen4. Ricciardo5. Bottas6. Sainz7. Leclerc8. Perez9. Grosjean10. Magnussen11. Alonso12. Hartley13. Stroll14. Vandoorne15. Sirotkin
2018-11-25T14:59:12Z: Hamilton steps out of his car, salutes the crowd and gets a hug from Alonso.
2018-11-25T14:58:12Z: The fans roar their appreciation on the home straight.
2018-11-25T14:57:43Z: Alonso joins the top two in returning to the grid for some final donuts - much like Felipe Massa did 12 laps ago.
2018-11-25T14:56:59Z: Leclerc holds off Perez for seventh, but it is Sainz in the Renault that wins the final 'Class B' battle of the year.
2018-11-25T14:55:50Z: Bottas ended up 32 seconds behind Ricciardo in fifth, which is pretty poor given his tyre situation at the end of the race.
2018-11-25T14:54:50Z: Hamilton signs off with some donuts on the cool down lap.
2018-11-25T14:54:31Z: Ricciardo has to be satisfied with fourth in his final F1 outing for Red Bull.
2018-11-25T14:54:05Z: Vettel follows the world champion home 2.5s adrift, with Verstappen completing the podium 12.7s behind Hamilton.
2018-11-25T14:53:27Z: Hamilton wins the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix!
2018-11-25T14:53:11Z: Vettel has extended his gap to Verstappen to nine seconds, but he's not going to get anyway near Hamilton.
2018-11-25T14:52:14Z: It's a bad end for Alonso. He's given a 5-second penalty for leaving the track and gaining an advantage. That won't go down well.
2018-11-25T14:51:23Z: Ricciardo is 2.7s adrift of Verstappen, so it looks like no farewell podium as his Red Bull career comes to an end.
2018-11-25T14:50:57Z: Alonso is pushing a little too hard as he goes straight on as he fights to get on terms with Magnussen.
2018-11-25T14:50:14Z: With three to go, Hamilton's lead is very much stable at 4.6s. We're now going to apologise for declaring a grandstand finish was on (and hope we're wrong again!).
2018-11-25T14:49:16Z: Hamilton sets a purple first sector - obviously, with 45 lap old tyres.
2018-11-25T14:48:17Z: Perez is also closing on Leclerc for seventh. The bottom half of the top 10 is certainly not settled yet.
2018-11-25T14:48:00Z: Bottas is actually falling away from Ricciardo - he's now 27.1s behind in P5.
2018-11-25T14:47:38Z: Alonso is closing on Magnussen. He's taken a second out of the Haas over the last lap or so. Can he end his F1 spell with a point?
2018-11-25T14:47:12Z: Four laps left in the race.
2018-11-25T14:46:52Z: The top three all set personal bests on their last laps - but the gaps are remaining stable.
2018-11-25T14:44:07Z: After that spate of retirements, Alonso is now in 11th. One more place and he can take a point in his final race. He's 3.9s behind Magnussen.
2018-11-25T14:43:40Z: Intriguingly, Bottas is lapping almost two seconds slower than Hamilton despite being on tyres that are 34 laps fresher - it's not been a vintage performance from the Finn today.
2018-11-25T14:43:28Z: Track goes green again after Gasly's car is pushed behind the barriers.
2018-11-25T14:42:08Z: Vettel can't make any in roads into Hamilton's lead - they both set a 1m42.7s last time around.
2018-11-25T14:41:04Z: The leaders are negotiating their way through a clutch of lapped cars.
2018-11-25T14:40:47Z: Gasly's continuing to race on in front of the leaders despite smoke pouring from the rear of his car.
2018-11-25T14:39:52Z: The Force India is still stuck in the pit entry and Ocon's last F1 race - for now, at least - ends in retirement. That promotes Grosjean and Gasly to the last places in the top 10.
2018-11-25T14:39:07Z: Another personal best for Hamilton - 1m42.388s - his lead is 4.9s over Vettel.
2018-11-25T14:37:17Z: So Ricciardo is 1.8s behind Verstappen, but that's not enough for a team orders situation, surely?
2018-11-25T14:35:53Z: Hamilton is once again the slowest of the leaders, but his rivals aren't exactly homing in.
2018-11-25T14:34:17Z: Hamilton does a personal best lap - 1m42.677s - which suggests he does have some pace in hand. Which is somewhat annoying if you've been promising a lively finish as we have.
2018-11-25T14:33:02Z: Just 12 laps to go on the 2018 season.
2018-11-25T14:32:36Z: Fastest lap for Bottas on his nice shiny ultras - a 1m40.953s
2018-11-25T14:31:24Z: The battle with Bottas has cost Verstappen relative to Vettel, he's 4.1s behind the Ferrari driver - they had been 1.5s apart.
2018-11-25T14:30:17Z: Stroll is the very last person to stop and drops to 15th place in his final race for Williams.
2018-11-25T14:29:49Z: Verstappen and Ricciardo are lapping a second a lap faster than Hamilton.
2018-11-25T14:29:16Z: Bottas's stop was effectively a 'free' stop as he had plenty of free air over the Class B runners.
2018-11-25T14:28:18Z: After all the stops the 'Class B' leaderboard has Sainz heading Leclerc, Perez, Magnussen and Ocon. Alonso is still down in 14th in his last race.
2018-11-25T14:26:41Z: Vettel has got Hamilton's lead down to 5.8s - remember when the Mercedes driver said he's tyres didn't feel great?
2018-11-25T14:26:03Z: Bottas fought back on the next 'straight' but Ricciardo hung up out to dry on the outside.
2018-11-25T14:25:35Z: Ricciardo closes in on Bottas with DRS into Turn 8 and dives down the inside to take P4.
2018-11-25T14:25:04Z: So Bottas has now fallen into Ricciardo's clutches - it's all going wrong for him today.
2018-11-25T14:24:32Z: Verstappen attacks Bottas into Turn 11 - he goes wide at the corner, gets alongside and they make light contact at the next apex, but Verstappen is by!
2018-11-25T14:24:31Z: Sainz finally pits, after a mammoth 37-lap stint but is able to stay ahead of Leclerc in the 'Class B' battle.
2018-11-25T14:23:38Z: Red Bull tells Verstappen it's in touch with the FIA over Bottas cutting the track.
2018-11-25T14:22:37Z: Verstappen is all over Bottas, but he can't find a way by - will Red Bull have to get him out of Ricciardo's way?
2018-11-25T14:21:59Z: Bottas has fallen to 3.1s behind Vettel.
2018-11-25T14:21:13Z: Fastest lap for Ricciardo - a 1m41.243s - he's flying up to Verstappen and Bottas.
2018-11-25T14:20:56Z: Bottas rejoined in front of Verstappen but he cut the track by a long way.
2018-11-25T14:20:41Z: Bottas rejoined in front of Verstappen but he cut the track by a long way.
2018-11-25T14:20:15Z: Bottas locks up and goes off at Turn 8!
2018-11-25T14:20:01Z: Replays show Bottas locked up and went wide at the Turns 5/6 chicane just before the hairpin, which put Vettel right on his tail.
2018-11-25T14:19:30Z: It's a five-second penalty for Ocon! That seems a tad harsh on the Force India driver who ran wide after making the pass and was already ahead of Vandoorne.
2018-11-25T14:19:26Z: So it's Vettel who is now Hamilton's closest challenger - but he's 7.1s behind.
2018-11-25T14:18:54Z: Vettel closes in on Bottas on the run to Turns 8/9 and Vettel blasts by on the run to the next chicane - he's up to second.
2018-11-25T14:18:37Z: McLarens and Toro Rossos are fighting in tandem. Gasly passes Vandoorne but Vandoone then fights back as Alonso and Hartley tussle behind.
2018-11-25T14:17:33Z: Ahead of all the excitement, Sainz is still circulating in sixth having not yet pitted. The two Williams cars haven't stopped yet either.
2018-11-25T14:17:02Z: Hamilton is back into the lead for the first time since he pitted under the VSC.
2018-11-25T14:16:46Z: Ocon is under investigation for that pass on Vandoorne when he ran wide after making the move.
2018-11-25T14:16:43Z: Ricciardo's gap to Verstappen is 7.9s and he's 17.1s off the lead.
2018-11-25T14:16:18Z: Ricciardo goes onto the supersofts, with 22 laps left to run - he's now back in P5.
2018-11-25T14:15:26Z: Ricciardo's pace is so strong his lead is up to 3.2s over Hamilton, but he will have to do some overtaking when he does come in.
2018-11-25T14:15:13Z: Grosjean now has another look at Vandoorne and this time goes round the outside of the McLaren to take the place into the chicane. Alonso is on the move though and passes Sirotkin, who isn't quite able to fight back.
2018-11-25T14:14:56Z: Bottas betters the fastest lap with a 1m42.975s.
2018-11-25T14:14:30Z: Ricciardo has just done a personal best lap up front - a 1m43.202s.
2018-11-25T14:14:06Z: Verstappen has the newest supersofts of the leaders - 14 laps - with Vettel's 16 laps old and Bottas running his set for 15 laps now. Hamilton's are on their 25th lap.
2018-11-25T14:13:59Z: But then Ocon runs wide! He's just about able to stay ahead of Vandoorne though. The battle for 13th is the one to watch at the moment!
2018-11-25T14:13:29Z: After that opportunistic move on Grosjean, Ocon and Vandoorne run side-by-side for several corners before the Force India finally takes the place.
2018-11-25T14:13:16Z: Bottas, Vettel and Verstappen are circulating in close attention, with Bottas now 6.6s behind Hamilton - remember, the world champion's tyres are nine laps older than his team-mate's.
2018-11-25T14:11:48Z: The top five are covered by 12.1s, but they are rather spread out within that gap.
2018-11-25T14:11:11Z: Fastest lap for Verstappen, he does a 1m43.000s.
2018-11-25T14:10:31Z: Ricciardo has managed to get the gap to Hamilton back up to three seconds.
2018-11-25T14:10:09Z: Gasly is the next person to stop, pitting from seventh.
2018-11-25T14:09:36Z: Fastest lap for Vettel - a 1m43.017s - and he's 1.5s behind Bottas in fourth.
2018-11-25T14:08:59Z: Ricciardo is still yet to pit - he starts lap 30, with his tyres now 33 laps old.
2018-11-25T14:08:08Z: Hamilton is now just 2.5s behind Ricciardo.
2018-11-25T14:07:46Z: Red Bull tells its drivers the wind has changed and it's a tailwind into Turns 1 and 11 - gusty stuff.
2018-11-25T14:07:06Z: Alonso pits for what could be the final time in an F1 race. He emerges in last place, however. Not what the Spaniard would've had in mind for his final race.
2018-11-25T14:06:12Z: Good scrap between Grosjean and Vandoorne, the McLaren driver just about holding on to 13th for now in his final race.
2018-11-25T14:05:11Z: Perez pits from the 'Class B' lead. Team-mate Ocon stopped much earlier in the race and Perez emerges four places ahead of Ocon, who was stuck in traffic.
2018-11-25T14:04:49Z: Ricciardo's lead is down to 3.6s, he lapped 1.4s slower than Hamilton last time around.
2018-11-25T14:04:12Z: As there's bad news for one Sauber, the other is the move! Leclerc grabs ninth place from Alonso at the first chicane after being one of the few drivers to make an early stop.
2018-11-25T14:03:53Z: Bottas hasn't made much progress with his fresher supersofts compared to Hamilton at this stage, he's 7.8s behind his team-mate in third.
2018-11-25T14:02:50Z: Hamilton gets the gap to Ricciardo under five seconds for the first time.
2018-11-25T14:02:36Z: Ericsson reports a lack of power as he grinds to a halt.
2018-11-25T14:02:09Z: Ericsson's slowing! Looks like the Sauber driver - another in possibly their last F1 race - might be retiring.
2018-11-25T14:01:45Z: Hartley is currently running last in what could be his last F1 race. But he's closed right in on Sirotkin. And then an error at the final corner allowed Hartley to squeeze ahead on the outside into Turn 1.
2018-11-25T14:01:41Z: Perhaps the age of Ricciardo's rubber is starting to show, Hamilton took 1.2s on the last lap to cut the lead to 5.2s.
2018-11-25T14:01:04Z: Ricciardo's ultrasofts are now 28 laps old, including the laps he did in Q2.
2018-11-25T14:00:32Z: It does appear as if the rain is falling harder on the main straight now, but Red Bull has told Ricciardo it doesn't expect it to fully wet the track.
2018-11-25T13:59:48Z: Ricciardo's lead is up to 6.5s over Hamilton.
2018-11-25T13:58:24Z: Some rain is starting to fall - but nothing to get excited about yet (even thought we're doing just that by writing this)
2018-11-25T13:57:50Z: Ricciardo, Vettel and Verstappen are lapping in the 1m43s right now, with the Mercedes cars in the 1m44s.
2018-11-25T13:56:55Z: 1 Ricciardo, 2 Hamilton, 3 Bottas, 4 Vettel, 5 Verstappen, 6 Perez.
2018-11-25T13:56:18Z: The closest gap in Class A is Verstappen's 1.5s gap to Vettel, P5 to P4.
2018-11-25T13:54:45Z: We're into a slight lull in the action up front as Ricciardo's lead hovers around six seconds, with Bottas now eight seconds behind Hamilton in third.
2018-11-25T13:53:17Z: Those ever accurate shots of team weather radar suggest there is some rain in the area.
2018-11-25T13:51:37Z: Ricciardo is extending his gap to Hamilton - slightly - it's up to 6.4s.
2018-11-25T13:51:26Z: That stop for Ocon has, however, dropped him right to the tail of the field as the 'Class B' runners are still quite bunched together after the early safety cars.
2018-11-25T13:50:20Z: Just as Sainz was lining up for a pass on Ocon, the Force India has now pitted from seventh.
2018-11-25T13:50:14Z: Verstappen set two purple sectors on his out lap - he's flying right now.
2018-11-25T13:49:40Z: Ricciardo leads by 6.2s over Hamilton, but he's yet to pit for Red Bull.
2018-11-25T13:49:16Z: Vettel is 2.8s behind Bottas, who has cut Hamilton's gap to 9.6s.
2018-11-25T13:48:36Z: Verstappen has swapped his hypersofts for supersofts and he'll also go to the end.
2018-11-25T13:48:14Z: Behind, Gasly attempts to pass Ericsson but it doesn't quite work out for the Toro Rosso driver, who stays 10th.
2018-11-25T13:47:41Z: Hamilton's tyres are nine laps older than Bottas's supersofts, which may be crucial come the end of the race.
2018-11-25T13:47:27Z: After dispatching Ericsson Sainz has now closed right in on Ocon.
2018-11-25T13:46:59Z: So Ricciardo leads Verstappen, with Hamilton up to third and 11.2s clear of Bottas.
2018-11-25T13:46:34Z: Bottas goes onto the supersofts and rejoins well in front of Vettel.
2018-11-25T13:45:52Z: Replays show that Vettel's right-rear ultrasoft was slow coming off at his stop.
2018-11-25T13:45:37Z: But Vettel blasts by on the main straight and takes P5 rather easily.
2018-11-25T13:45:16Z: Vettel rejoins P6, behind Ocon. If the stop had been faster, he'd have remained clear of the Force India.
2018-11-25T13:45:02Z: Vettel went onto the supersofts, but it was a slightly slow stop at 3.7s.
2018-11-25T13:44:13Z: TV pictures now show Hulkenberg walking back to the paddock after that terrifying first-lap shunt.
2018-11-25T13:44:10Z: Ferrari confirms on Twitter that Raikkonen's car shutdown with an electrical failure.
2018-11-25T13:43:33Z: Bottas pulled out 0.5s on Vettel to extend his gap to 2.5s last time around.
2018-11-25T13:43:06Z: Sainz and Ericsson are having a great scrap for eighth. After one failed attempt, the Renault driver has now passed Ericsson into the chicane.
2018-11-25T13:42:57Z: Just as we wonder about an intra-Red Bull battle, Verstappen falls back to 1.1s back. That's on us, sorry.
2018-11-25T13:42:21Z: Verstappen is right with Ricciardo now - is one final battle coming up between the team-mates coming up?
2018-11-25T13:41:13Z: Verstappen now just 0.7s behind Ricciardo, but the Red Bull pair are catching Vettel and Bottas ahead.
2018-11-25T13:39:42Z: Things have calmed down at the head of the race, although Verstappen is now within DRS range of Ricciardo.
2018-11-25T13:38:45Z: Verstappen lapped one second faster than Bottas last time around.
2018-11-25T13:38:22Z: Vettel locks up at Turn 8 - that won't do his tyres much good.
2018-11-25T13:38:02Z: Hamilton has fallen to three seconds behind Verstappen - presumably managing his supersofts to the end of the race.
2018-11-25T13:37:49Z: Grosjean is starting to make some progress after that early stop and has just passed Sirotkin for 16th. Don't forget he was the leading 'Class B' runner on the grid and has already had an eventful race after clashing with Hulkenberg in that dramatic first lap.
2018-11-25T13:37:09Z: Verstappen is now just 1.2s behind Ricciardo's third place, but he's still on the softer hypersoft rubber.
2018-11-25T13:36:15Z: But Bottas has pulled away from Vettel again - his lead is up to 1.9s.
2018-11-25T13:35:57Z: Replays show Hartley brushed the wall on lap four - that explains why he pitted earlier and is currently running last.
2018-11-25T13:35:29Z: Last time around, Vettel was 0.7s quicker than Bottas.
2018-11-25T13:35:19Z: Alonso has - for once - survived the chaos of the opening few laps and is currently in 11th place in what is expected to be his final F1 race.
2018-11-25T13:35:05Z: At the front of the race, Vettel is now within DRS range of Bottas.
2018-11-25T13:34:46Z: Verstappen has pulled away from Hamilton, he's 1.8s in front in a secure P4.
2018-11-25T13:34:06Z: Hamilton's VSC stop means he's just 8.8s off the lead, but he has switched to the harder rubber.
2018-11-25T13:33:35Z: Hamilton closes up to Verstappen and passes him for fourth at the Turn 8/9 chicane, but Verstappen fights back and takes the place on the next straight!
2018-11-25T13:33:00Z: So Bottas now leads Vettel by 1.4s.
2018-11-25T13:32:38Z: After that flurry of early stops, Ocon is now the leader of 'Class B' in sixth ahead of his Force India team-mate Perez.
2018-11-25T13:32:21Z: We're racing again on lap nine.
2018-11-25T13:31:42Z: Leclerc also came into the pits under the VSC and rejoined in P14 on new supersofts.
2018-11-25T13:30:38Z: Further back, the contact with Hulkenberg doesn't seem to be hampering Grosjean as he was still running in seventh before making an early stop.
2018-11-25T13:30:20Z: Hamilton switched to to fresh set of supersofts, he's rejoined in P5.
2018-11-25T13:29:26Z: Replays show Verstappen made slight contact with Ocon during his second attempted pass at the hairpin, which sent the Force India driver wide.
2018-11-25T13:28:52Z: Raikkonen is out of his final race for Ferrari - the VSC is deployed.
2018-11-25T13:28:06Z: Raikkonen has pulled over on the pit straight!
2018-11-25T13:27:29Z: Verstappen tries again into the second chicane. And this time it works and he moves up to eighth.
2018-11-25T13:27:22Z: Hamilton's lead is up to 2.1s over Bottas, with Vettel 0.7s further back in third.
2018-11-25T13:26:58Z: And Verstappen this time makes the move work at the hairpin again but Ocon powers past on the straight again!
2018-11-25T13:26:35Z: Hamilton sets a fastest lap (obviously as that was the first one at full speed) - a 1m43.982s
2018-11-25T13:26:29Z: Verstappen is told to use the C3 reset to try and get his engine running normally again.
2018-11-25T13:25:58Z: Leclerc has pulled a nice gap on Ricciardo in fifth place - maybe he's already in 2019 Ferrari driver mode?
2018-11-25T13:25:01Z: Vettel and Raikkonen are further back from Bottas, with Leclerc nicely ahead of Ricciardo.
2018-11-25T13:24:29Z: Hamilton pulled a 1.2s gap over Bottas at the restart.
2018-11-25T13:24:05Z: We're back racing at the start of lap five.
2018-11-25T13:23:48Z: Hamilton is backing the pack up, ready for the restart.
2018-11-25T13:23:03Z: The safety car is coming in at the end of this lap, the pack is onto the second long (but curved) straight.
2018-11-25T13:21:43Z: The stewards have already decided there will be no further action following that dramatic collision for Grosjean and Hulkenberg.
2018-11-25T13:20:56Z: We're onto lap three, with the safety car still leading the pack around.
2018-11-25T13:19:56Z: Verstappen is down in ninth after making a good start, but he didn't accelerate as expected.
2018-11-25T13:19:24Z: Hamilton held the lead off the line in front of Bottas, with Vettel and Raikkonen following them in third and fourth.
2018-11-25T13:19:23Z: Hulkenberg was fighting with Grosjean, who was trying to go around the outside into the first part of the chicane. But Hulkenberg didn't leave much space for the Haas driver who was still on the inside for the second part and the contact fired the Renault into a roll.
2018-11-25T13:18:25Z: Leclerc managed to make it past Ricciardo just as the Hulkenberg accident was unfolding, although the Red Bull driver had been able to stay in front at the chicane at the end of the main straight.
2018-11-25T13:18:01Z: Hulkenberg is now walking out away from the car after the Renault has been rolled back onto its wheels.
2018-11-25T13:17:13Z: Hartley has pitted during this safety car period
2018-11-25T13:16:29Z: With the halo device in place and the Renault up against the barrier, the car is having to be rolled over by marshals to allow him to get out
2018-11-25T13:14:48Z: Leclerc attacks Ricciardo for fifth  at the chicane.
2018-11-25T13:14:34Z: Further back, Leclerc pounces on Grosjean into Turn 1 to grab the 'Class B lead'.
2018-11-25T13:14:21Z: Alonso and Grosjean go wide through Turn 1
2018-11-25T13:13:44Z: The lights are out and we’re racing for the final time this season!
2018-11-25T13:13:03Z: Hamilton brings the pack onto the grid for the last time in 2018.
2018-11-25T13:09:25Z: Of the drivers outside of the top 10 with free choice of tyres, Sainz, Perez, Alonso and Hartley have gone for ultrasofts, but everyone else has the hardest compound of the weekend - supersofts.
2018-11-25T13:03:57Z: Fernando Alonso has just climbed aboard his McLaren for what is likely to be his final F1 race. The double world champion will start from P15.
2018-11-25T13:01:49Z: The front five will start on the ultrasoft tyres after making it through Q2 with the harder rubber, but Verstappen will be on the hypersofts.
2018-11-25T13:01:30Z: Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen make it an all-Ferrari second row ahead of Red Bull pair Daniel Ricciardo - making his last start for the team - and Max Verstappen.
2018-11-25T12:58:31Z: Lewis Hamilton starts from pole for the 11th time this year and will line-up on the front row alongside his Mercedes team-mate Valtteri Bottas, who won this race 12 months ago.
2018-11-25T12:56:44Z: Welcome to our Live coverage of the 2018 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. We’re just under 15 minutes away from the start of the final Formula 1 race of the season.
